div.div: Parents and Students, would you like to receive text messages about school closings and other important information? If so, login to your PowerSchool account and verify your contact information includes your cell phone, then text YES to 87569 to opt into the district's messaging service.

img.div:
Murphysboro CUSD 186, where “P.R.I.D.E” means being Punctual, showing Respect, exhibiting Integrity, and practicing Discipline ultimately to display Excellence in all we do.
Murphysboro CUSD 186 in active partnership with family and community shall empower individuals to become part of a larger learning community and develop confidence in their skills in order to meaningfully participate in a changing society, utilizing cloud-based computing, Murphysboro extends their learning opportunities beyond the traditional school structure assisting in the development of personalized learning networks for each individual.
Murphysboro CUSD 186 is a progressive district that is unified in our commitment to educational excellence. As a team who looks at data for improvements we challenge ourselves, each other and our students utilizing technology to leverage our goals allowing our students to reach their highest level of achievement.

div.div:
The State Board of Education has provided additional guidance to schools during this pandemic.
You can find some of their info at https://www.isbe.net/covid19 and also https://www.isbe.net/keeplearning.
The district plan is HERE.
Packets of materials for GJAL is at https://gjal.cusd186.org/
Links the students at GJAL use can be found at https://gjaltech.weebly.com/
Packets of materials for CARR is at https://carr.cusd186.org/
Also, we are still serving lunch to any student that wants a meal. This meal program is funded by the USDA, Administered by ISBE and Sponsored by Murphysboro CUSD 186.
Murphysboro CUSD 186 will be changing meal delivery days beginning Wednesday April 15th. Deliveries will be Monday, Wednesday, Friday. Two days worth of meals will be distributed on those days.
Pick-up locations are:
Murphysboro Middle School 11-12
Bocce Ball Court 11-12
20th and Wall 11-11:30
United Methodist Church 11:30-12
Murphysboro Youth and Rec 12-12:30
Gorham Fire Department 11-12
Pomona Town Hall 11-11:45
Old Rome Parking Lot 11:35-12
Murphysboro Food Pantry (breakfast & lunch) 9am-11am
The district will also be using two white activity busses to deliver food from 11:00 to 1:00 along the following routes:
Bridgewood, Valley Ridge, New Horizons
New Hill, Old Brick Road
Hoffman Road
Mobile Ranch
Happy Ours
Cinnamon Lane
Area North of Hardees
If you see the bus, you are welcome to come to the bus and pick-up a meal. If there are other regions that we have overlooked, please call the district office at 618-684-3781 and leave a message.
By Steve Carrington

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
